uniqueIssues.issue: Header region is not marked up with a semantic <header> landmark, which can hinder landmark navigation.

uniqueIssues.issue: Form controls are not contained within a semantic <form> element, making relationships and submission semantics not programmatically determinable.
uniqueIssues.suggestedFix: Replace the container with a form element and handle submit via onSubmit. Example: <form className="contact-form" onSubmit={(e) => { e.preventDefault(); handleSubmit(); }}> ... </form>.

uniqueIssues.issue: Input field has no associated label; placeholder text is not a sufficient label.
uniqueIssues.suggestedFix: Provide an explicit <label> tied via id/htmlFor. Example: <label htmlFor="firstName">First Name</label><input id="firstName" name="firstName" type="text" placeholder="First Name" />.

uniqueIssues.issue: Input field has no associated label; placeholder text is not a sufficient label.
uniqueIssues.suggestedFix: Provide an explicit <label> tied via id/htmlFor. Example: <label htmlFor="lastName">Last Name</label><input id="lastName" name="lastName" type="text" placeholder="Last Name" />.

uniqueIssues.issue: Input field has no associated label; placeholder text is not a sufficient label.

uniqueIssues.issue: Textarea has no associated label; placeholder text is not a sufficient label.
uniqueIssues.suggestedFix: Provide an explicit <label> tied via id/htmlFor. Example: <label htmlFor="message">Your Message</label><textarea id="message" name="message" rows="5" placeholder="Your Message"></textarea>.

uniqueIssues.issue: Submit action is implemented with a non-interactive <div> and onClick, preventing keyboard users from activating it.
uniqueIssues.suggestedFix: Use a semantic <button type="submit"> inside a <form>. Example: <button className="submit-btn" type="submit">Click Here to Submit</button> and handle submission via the form's onSubmit.

uniqueIssues.issue: Main content is not identified with a semantic <main> landmark, making it harder for assistive technologies to navigate.
uniqueIssues.suggestedFix: Wrap the primary page content in a <main> element. Example: <main className="app" id="main-content"> ... </main>.

uniqueIssues.issue: No mechanism is provided to bypass repeated header content, such as a 'Skip to main content' link.
uniqueIssues.suggestedFix: Add a visually persistent, keyboard-focusable skip link as the first focusable element. Example: Skip to main content and ensure the main region has id="main-content".

uniqueIssues.issue: Non-interactive element used as a button is not keyboard accessible. Users cannot activate this control via keyboard.
uniqueIssues.suggestedFix: Use a semantic button or anchor element so it is focusable and operable by keyboard. For example: or Book Now.

uniqueIssues.issue: Control lacks proper semantic role and accessible name/value when implemented as a div.
uniqueIssues.suggestedFix: Replace the div with a native <button> or <a>. If you must keep a non-semantic element, add role="button", tabindex="0", and keyboard handlers for Enter/Space, but prefer <button> for proper semantics.

uniqueIssues.issue: Non-descriptive control label 'Click Here' does not describe its purpose.
uniqueIssues.suggestedFix: Use a descriptive label that conveys purpose, e.g., <button type="button" className="btn btn-primary">Book Now</button>.

uniqueIssues.suggestedFix: Use a descriptive label that includes the destination/content, e.g., Learn more about The Silent Oasis.

uniqueIssues.suggestedFix: Provide meaningful alt text, e.g., alt={room.name} or a short description like alt={`${room.name} room`}.

uniqueIssues.issue: Availability is conveyed by a color-only status dot without text, relying on color alone to communicate information.
uniqueIssues.suggestedFix: Include a text label (visible or visually hidden) conveying status, e.g., {room.available ? 'Available' : 'Booked'} or add aria-label to the dot and include adjacent text.

uniqueIssues.issue: Non-interactive element used as a link/button is not keyboard accessible.
uniqueIssues.suggestedFix: Use a semantic or

uniqueIssues.issue: Control lacks proper semantic role and accessible name/value when implemented as a span.
uniqueIssues.suggestedFix: Replace with a native <a> or <button>. If kept as span (not recommended), add role="button", tabindex="0", and keyboard handlers.

uniqueIssues.issue: Label 'Read More' is not specific and does not clearly describe the purpose.
uniqueIssues.suggestedFix: Use a descriptive label tied to the room, e.g., Read more about {room.name} or add aria-label including the room name.

uniqueIssues.issue: Small text uses a low-contrast gold color likely failing minimum 4.5:1 contrast against the light background.
uniqueIssues.suggestedFix: Increase color contrast by darkening the text color (e.g., #7a5a20 or darker) or using a darker background. Verify with a contrast checker to reach at least 4.5:1 for 12px text.

uniqueIssues.issue: Small label text uses a low-contrast gold color likely failing minimum 4.5:1 contrast against the light background.
uniqueIssues.suggestedFix: Darken the label color or increase font size/weight sufficiently; preferably choose a color that achieves at least 4.5:1 contrast on #faf9f7.

uniqueIssues.issue: Focus indicator for inputs relies on a low-contrast gold border that likely does not meet the 3:1 non-text contrast requirement against adjacent colors.
uniqueIssues.suggestedFix: Provide a stronger focus indicator, e.g., outline: 2px solid #5b3a00; outline-offset: 2px; or a thicker border with a darker color that achieves at least 3:1 contrast with the background.

uniqueIssues.issue: White text on a gold gradient background likely fails minimum 4.5:1 contrast.
uniqueIssues.suggestedFix: Use a darker text color (e.g., #1a1a1a) on the gold background, or darken the gradient significantly to ensure 4.5:1 contrast with white text.

uniqueIssues.issue: Hover state sets link text to a low-contrast gold color on white, likely failing the 4.5:1 requirement.
uniqueIssues.suggestedFix: Choose a hover color with sufficient contrast (e.g., a darker shade of gold/brown) or add a contrasting background/underline with sufficient thickness to maintain readability.

uniqueIssues.issue: Hover state for navigation items uses a low-contrast gold color on a very light header background, likely failing 4.5:1 contrast.
uniqueIssues.suggestedFix: Use a darker hover color that meets 4.5:1 contrast against the header background or apply an additional high-contrast indicator (e.g., bold text plus underline) with sufficient contrast.

uniqueIssues.issue: White text on a gold gradient background for the primary action likely fails minimum text contrast.
uniqueIssues.suggestedFix: Use a darker text color on the gold background, or darken the gradient background to ensure at least 4.5:1 contrast with white text. Example: background: #8a6a2a; color: #fff; or keep current background and set color: #1a1a1a.

uniqueIssues.issue: Global removal of outlines hides keyboard focus indicators across the site, making it difficult or impossible for keyboard users to determine the current focus.
Links are styled without underlines and (combined with color: inherit) become indistinguishable from surrounding text, removing a non-color cue that indicates link functionality.
Low-contrast text color (#cccccc) on a white background fails minimum contrast requirements for normal text.
Status is conveyed solely by color (green dot for "available"), which is not accessible to users who cannot perceive color differences.
Status is conveyed solely by color (red dot for "booked"), which is not accessible to users who cannot perceive color differences.
Gold text (#c9a962) on a white background provides insufficient contrast for normal-sized text in table cells.
Links inside the price note are styled without underlines and inherit the surrounding text color, making them indistinguishable from body text (no non-color indicator).

Hover state for the room link sets the text to gold (#c9a962) on a white background, which has insufficient contrast for normal-sized link text.
